intro: Cirrhopetalum skeatianum, commonly known as the Skeat's cirrhopetalum, is a rare flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Melanthiaceae and is characterized by its striking, showy flowers that bloom in late spring. The plant has narrow, linear leaves and produces clusters of small, pale yellow to greenish-white flowers. It thrives in cool, moist environments and is often found in shaded forest understories. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species.
